Name: AOD

Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: A theme based on the design for neatline.org

Name: Avantgarde

Name: Berlin
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Abstraction of the Making the History of 1989 theme.

Name: Big Picture
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: A new Omeka theme.

Name: BigStuff
Author: Doug Palmer
Description: Theme for use with conference papers, based on Berlin.

Name: Bootstrap
Author: Daniel Berthereau (based on a work of Garrick S. Bodine and Amanda Regan)
Description: A grid-based theme based on the Twitter Bootstrap framework (http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap). Based on the Omeka Boostrap theme by Garrick S. Bodine for https://mbda.berry.edu, updated by Daniel Berthereau, and by Amanda Regan for https://www.wearinggayhistory.com.

Name: Center Row
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Image-oriented theme for Omeka. This theme does not support nested top navigation.

Name: Curatescape
Author: Erin Bell
Description: Responsive, mobile-first theme for Curatescape projects.
Tags: Curatescape, mobile-first, responsive, smartphone, tablet, configurable, custom css, apps, maps

Name: Dark
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: A theme in shades of gray and black.

Name: DBVa
Author: Library of Virginia
Description: A theme developed for use with the Library of Virginia's Document Bank of Virginia. Theme is built upon the Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media Season Theme version 2.2.1.

Name: Deco
Author: E.Bell
Description: Configurable theme with featured image gallery (Awkward Showcase) on homepage and built-in lightbox (FancyBox) on items/show pages, plus lots of other configurable theme options, including custom homepage text, switchable stylesheets, and more. Also includes some basic theme styling for the Exhibit Builder and MyOmeka plugins, as well as handy inclusion of DocsViewer template code.  Based loosely on Berlin theme by Jeremy Boggs and Ken Albers.

Name: DH @ Harvard
Author: DH @ Harvard
Description: Based on the Berlin theme from Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media.

Name: Emancipation
Author: Jason Roma
Description: Thanks Roy theme altered for use with Library of Virginia online exhibition, Emancipation

Name: Emiglio
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Named after our favorite robot. A simple, minimal theme with reds and greens.

Name: Expanding Archive
Author: Orpheus Peng
Description: The theme used in the website of Denison University Expanding Archive Project.

Name: From Scratch
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: A styleless, barebones theme for designers who want to start from scratch.

Name: From Scratch
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: A styleless, barebones theme for designers who want to start from scratch.

Name: GLAM

Description: Theme for OpenGLAM collections.

Description: A theme using the baseline and 960 grids, and excessive Helvetica.

Description: The default theme for exhibitions created within Grinnell College.
